title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 104.3 - Trapping
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 104.3 - Trapping

State Regulations
(a) No person shall
trap in the area unless he possesses a valid New York State trapping license
and a special trapping permit obtainable from the Department of Environmental

Conservation. (b) Applications for
trapping permits shall be submitted by September first to the Regional Wildlife

Manager at the Department of Environmental Conservation, 21 South Putt Corners

Road, New Paltz, NY 12561. All applications must include a current trapping
license number. (c) The quota of
permits to be issued each year shall be determined by the department. (d) Permits will be issued following a random
drawing to the extent of the quota fixed. All applicants will be notified in
writing whether they are successful or not. (e) Permittees may trap only those species
specified in their permits. (f) No
person shall trap in areas or at times other than those specified in his
permit. (g) Within 10 days after
the close of the trapping period designated on their permits, permittees shall
(on forms provided by the department) furnish the department with complete
reports of their trapping activities. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
104.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
